contextId.occurrenceNote: Malachi asks these questions in order to remind his fellow Israelites about what they already know. Alternate translation: "You know that we all have one father, that our God has created a nation out of us." or "You all know that God is the father of all us Israelites, because he is the one who made our nation." (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/writing-background]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-rquestion]])
contextId.glQuote: Is there not one father for us all? Has not one God created us?

contextId.occurrenceNote: This statement assumes that this woman is still living. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/writing-background]])
contextId.glQuote: Yahweh was a witness between you and the wife of your youth

contextId.occurrenceNote: This statement implies that many of the Israelites had divorced their wives. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/writing-background]])
contextId.glQuote: she was your companion and your wife by covenant

contextId.occurrenceNote: This expression implies making husband and wife one flesh. Alternate translation: "make husband and wife one flesh" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/writing-background]])
